meta.content: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Digg, pictures, technology, breaking news, entertainment, politics, headline news, celebrity news, offbeat, world business, sports, funny videos

meta.name: description
meta.content: The most interesting and talked about stories, videos and pictures on the web. Breaking news on Technology, Politics, Entertainment, and more!

meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: A northeast blizzard dumped up to three feet of snow overnight Friday and brought hurricane-force wind gusts to areas between New York and Maine.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y0Ra20&via=Digg&text=Pictures From Historic Northeast Blizzard

div.a: From Terminator To Toy Story: Drones For A Better Tomorrow

div.div: Unmanned aerial vehicles are no longer the preserve of the military. Civilian drones have arrived, and they're here to help you.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12yZMCF&via=Digg&text=From Terminator To Toy Story: Drones For A Better Tomorrow

div.div: More than 100 police officers headed into the San Bernardino Mountains today searching for suspected cop-killer Christopher Dorner, a former LAPD officer who has vowed "warfare" against the department.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12BSrT6&via=Digg&text=Still On The Run

div.a: These Are The FBI's Favorite Things To Pirate

div.div: The FBI like to take down sites like MegaUpload, but that doesn't mean they don't torrent, themselves. TorrentFreak dug up a little list of what's been being pirated from FBI IPs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11xyEF0&via=Digg&text=These Are The FBI's Favorite Things To Pirate

div.a: Ron Paul Files International Copyright Complaint Against His Own Fans

div.div: The former congressman really wants control of RonPaul.com. His followers aren't pleased.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WBqyqJ&via=Digg&text=Ron Paul Files International Copyright Complaint Against His Own Fans

div.a: Here's How Not To Drive In Moscow

div.div: One of Russia's most renowned and criminally reckless street drivers was recently brought to justice. And he left behind some videos.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XZTINV&via=Digg&text=Here's How Not To Drive In Moscow

div.div: Citizens in Space, a project of the United States Rocket Academy, announced two astronaut candidates at the Space Exploration Educators Conference.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WM0tUk&via=Digg&text=New Citizen Astronaut Candidates Announced

div.a: Alleged Killer Cop Found And Returned Thousands Of Dollars To A Church In 2002

div.div: In a development that's sure to add members to alleged murderer Christopher Dorner's burgeoning fan base, it's been uncovered that Dorner was once profiled by an Oklahoma newspaper for a remarkable act of good citizenship.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WMtsr1&via=Digg&text=Alleged Killer Cop Found And Returned Thousands Of Dollars To A Church In 2002

div.a: Zuckerberg Met With Snapchat Founders Just Before He Ripped Them Off

div.div: It's no coincidence that Poke and Snapchat looked alike. Snapchat's founders say Mark Zuckerberg met with them in early December, a few weeks before Poke launched.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xi8gua&via=Digg&text=Zuckerberg Met With Snapchat Founders Just Before He Ripped Them Off

div.div: This is appropriately called the Airplane house and it was built in Abuja, Nigera, by a wealthy business man, Said Jammal for his wife who loves to travel!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XdSL6x&via=Digg&text=12 Architectural Oddities

div.a: Maker’s Mark Waters Down Its Bourbon To Meet Rising Demand

div.div: The bourbon brand, known for its bottles sealed with red wax, told customers today that it’s reducing the amount of alcohol in the beverage by 3% in order to meet rising global demand.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UPYjGg&via=Digg&text=Maker’s Mark Waters Down Its Bourbon To Meet Rising Demand

div.a: Diddy Gets New York Magazine Tattoo

div.div: Better than a Romney tattoo on your face.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WWpmxX&via=Digg&text=Diddy Gets New York Magazine Tattoo

div.a: Photographer Arranges Huge Collection Of Camera Gear Into One Picture

div.div: Arranged by hand without the use of digital post-production tools, the shot documents cameras, lenses and other accessories collected from 20 different photographers in the Portland area.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VIO6WV&via=Digg&text=Photographer Arranges Huge Collection Of Camera Gear Into One Picture

div.div: THE THINGS WE DO FOR LOVE

div.a: Famous Pianist Serenades Endangered Tortoises To Get Them In The Mood

div.div: The world's most successful pianist visited the London Zoo to provide a sexy soundtrack, but the tortoises were not impressed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TVHYhx&via=Digg&text=Famous Pianist Serenades Endangered Tortoises To Get Them In The Mood

div.a: What Are Dogs Saying When They Bark?

div.div: Experiments have now shown that dogs use different barks and growls to communicate different things.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11Vl4ur&via=Digg&text=What Are Dogs Saying When They Bark?

div.a: In Brazil, Footage Of Spiders Showering The Skies

div.div: In the Brazilian town of Santo Antônio da Platina, spiders known as Anelosimus eximius were shot by Erick Reis as they showered the sky.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W8ionZ&via=Digg&text=In Brazil, Footage Of Spiders Showering The Skies

div.a: Google's Jets May Get Their Own $82 Million Complex

div.div: The Mineta San Jose International Airport in California may be getting a new 29-acre, $82 million facility — that would exist in large part to store and service Google's private jets.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V68R1C&via=Digg&text=Google's Jets May Get Their Own $82 Million Complex

div.div: It happens the Saturday before the Super Bowl, and the most accurate summary of it probably came from Brian Lorei when he announced shortly before the race, “Guys, I’m gonna fall down a lot.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WUqDFK&via=Digg&text=America’s Drunkest Bike Race

div.a: British Outrage Grows As Horsemeat Pops Up In More Foods

div.div: The British are not happy with the growing bundle of evidence that some of the beef products on the shelves of their own supermarkets once had manes and hooves.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UOSw3R&via=Digg&text=British Outrage Grows As Horsemeat Pops Up In More Foods

div.a: Monopoly Turns Us Into Capitalist Vultures

div.div: In its original version, players could pay their rent to a common pool. Today, the game celebrates ruthlessness.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xi6o4F&via=Digg&text=Monopoly Turns Us Into Capitalist Vultures

div.a: Scenes From The History Of Snow Removal

div.div: In some areas, the weather outside is pretty frightful. And since you've no place to go but outside to shovel, get cozy and read about snow removal in the good old days.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WYm6Pl&via=Digg&text=Scenes From The History Of Snow Removal

div.a: The Case Against Saving For College

div.div: This stance has nothing at all to do with the validity of college savings plans themselves. The opinions expressed here are based entirely on the idea that your money could be, and should be, better spent.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VMEnEn&via=Digg&text=The Case Against Saving For College

div.a: This 1922 Kodachrome Test Footage Is Strangely Bewitching

div.div: This clip is a very early, full-color Kodachrome film made by Kodak in 1922 to test new film stock and color processing. It is a lovely little four-and-a-half minutes of pretty actresses gesturing for the camera.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14HX0tz&via=Digg&text=This 1922 Kodachrome Test Footage Is Strangely Bewitching

div.a: Satellite Images Of Penguin Guano From Space Lead To Discovery Of 9,000 Penguins

div.div: In 2009, scientists noticed some odd stains cropping up in satellite images of Antarctica's Princess Ragnhild Coast. Now, explorers have traveled there -- the first humans to visit the 9,000-odd emperor penguin kingdom.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xes7ug&via=Digg&text=Satellite Images Of Penguin Guano From Space Lead To Discovery Of 9,000 Penguins

div.a: Sorry, There Are No Alien Signals From Exoplanets

div.div: Intelligent alien life is likely relatively rare throughout our Milky Way galaxy, with fewer than one in a million solar systems harboring civilizations advanced enough to send out radio signals.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Z0icf1&via=Digg&text=Sorry, There Are No Alien Signals From Exoplanets

div.div: In a newly discovered 1964 tape from the BBC archives, Alfred Hitchcock claims his most shocking film was a joke. But would he be horrified to find people taking him seriously?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xdo4ON&via=Digg&text=Was 'Psycho' A Comedy?

div.div: Eighteen months after the phrase first entered the collective public consciousness, the plight of the 99 percent is coming to mainstream superhero comics.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UOltgi&via=Digg&text=DC Comics Exploits 'Occupy' With New 'Movement'

div.a: Mysterious Buildings Assembled From Found Photographs

div.div: Jim Kazanjian sifts through a library of some 25,000 images from which he carefully selects the perfect elements to digitally assemble mysterious buildings born from the mind of an architect gone mad.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XSFzRv&via=Digg&text=Mysterious Buildings Assembled From Found Photographs

div.a: The Supermarket Apocalypse Is Upon Us

div.div: Heeding increasingly loud warnings, people throughout the region took it upon themselves to get stocked up. As is the case in these situations, that left supermarkets looking rather, well, apocalyptic.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xe3SfJ&via=Digg&text=The Supermarket Apocalypse Is Upon Us

div.div: For more than two years Margot Woelk had to taste Hitler's food to ensure it was not poisoned. She feasted on fresh fruit and vegetables including asparagus, peppers and peas, while her fellow Germans were being rationed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WLElcw&via=Digg&text=I Was Hitler's Food Taster

div.a: 5 Homeland Security 'Bots Coming To Spy On You

div.div: It's been 10 years since the Department of Homeland Security started up operations. During that decade, DHS has moved to the forefront of deploying drones that could be coming soon to a neighborhood near you.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11uuYUu&via=Digg&text=5 Homeland Security 'Bots Coming To Spy On You

div.a: AOL Is The Weirdest Successful Tech Company In America

div.div: It's a historic day for one of America's most confounding companies.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YfFEP7&via=Digg&text=AOL Is The Weirdest Successful Tech Company In America

div.a: Don’t Take Medical Advice From The New York Times Magazine

div.div: The dangerous chemophobia behind its popular story about childhood arthritis.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YHzcT9&via=Digg&text=Don’t Take Medical Advice From The New York Times Magazine
